headline: Farmer's Market Vegetarian Quesadillas
description: Making the most of simple, fresh ingredients found at your local Farmer's Market, these quesadillas make great appetizers or a quick and healthy meal.
name: Farmer's Market Vegetarian Quesadillas
recipeIngredient: 1.25 cups shredded reduced-fat sharp Cheddar cheese

recipeInstructions.text: In a large nonstick pan, cook red pepper, zucchini, yellow squash, onion, and mushrooms in olive oil over medium to medium-high heat for about 7 minutes, or until just tender. Remove vegetables from pan.

Coat the same pan with cooking spray, and place one tortilla in pan. Sprinkle 1/4 cup of cheese evenly over tortilla, and layer 3/4 cup of the vegetable mixture over the cheese. Sprinkle another 1/8 cup of cheese on the vegetables, and top with a second tortilla. Cook until golden on both sides, for approximately 2 to 3 minutes per side. Remove quesadilla from pan, and repeat with remaining ingredients. Cut each quesadilla into 8 triangles with a pizza cutter. Serve hot.

review.reviewBody: This was great! I liked sautéing the veggies first then adding them to the quesadilla. Being I was making 8, I used a sheet pan lined with parchment paper and baked them all at once at 350 for 6-8 minutes. Served them with rice, corn, avocado and fresh salsa.
Serve hot, as the leftovers get soggy. Serve with dipping options, such as salsa, guacamole, or sour cream. Very good!
I gave this 4 stars for the idea. I made it with the vegetables I had on hand. It was delicious.
Absolutely wonderful and super easy. Great for a quick bite.
Very good recipe. The sauteed vegetables counterbalance the cheese for a somewhat lighter meal. Delicious.

I really loved this quesadilla that I've made last summer too. I've brought all the veggies you would find at a farmer's market and purchased it at my local grocery store instead. I've made it with sour cream and homemade guacamole to give it some zip. No substitutes for this one. Love it!
I made this recipe minus the mushrooms, personal preference, very good! It was a nice surprise for my vegetarian daughter in law. She loved it!
I loved this recipe! Its so versatile.. you can use any vegs! Great for a weeknight dinner. Fast and healthy!

I agree with another reviewer that these are 10 stars! Made them according to the recipe except for the mushrooms and peppers, since I don't care for these. I added lite sour cream, salsa and homemade guacamole and they were just fabulous. Will be enjoying these all summer. Thanks for the great recipe!!
Healthy and fresh!
This is one of my favorite recipes out there. And its so simple to make, for people who need quick and easy recipes.
I really like this. A great way to get a variety of veggies in me. Will definitely make again.
Really good and easy!

Turned out as expected. I made according to recipe. I generally do, and then decides how to improve. Be sure to add some sort of spice or fajita mix because otherwise bland. Served w salsa and sour cream.

We switched out the mushrooms for sweet onions since my husband doesn’t like mushrooms. But this was great! Never thought to put so many veggies into a quesadilla since we just moved to being pescatarian

I don't know why quesadillas haven't been in our dinner rotation. I used green peppers, green onions, bok Choi and zucchini. I used packaged shredded tex mex cheese and a sprinkle of taco seasoning.
Thank you for giving me this idea. My husband isn't complaining and he's eating vegetables. I consider this a win!
My normally meat-focused family didn't miss the meat at all in this recipe. Even my 17-year-old son who normally hates mushrooms thought it rocked! Will definitely be making this again.

A tasty and healthy dinner option. I modified the ingredients to more suit our taste. I added a dash (1/8 tsp each) of sea salt, garlic powder and dried basil. I reduced the amount of cheese using 1/8 cup on the bottom and 1/8 on the top. Great meal even my non vegetarian wife liked it.,
Divine!!! I also added some sautéed chicken strips for protein. Family loves this!
I made a vegan version. Substituted the cheese for vegan cheddar. It was simple and delicious

Quesadillas using ONLY ingredients one can find at the local Farmer’s market, what a great idea. Shop local! Our town is pretty small, and the farmer’s market tends to die down a little around the end of summer, so i had to make due with a Kale, Radish, and brussel sprout quesadilla. Topped that off with some freshly made LOCAL cheese curds. Not the sort of combination i would usually try, but it’s worth keeping our local farmers’ tables as full as mine!
Boom! Perfect for that easy dinner or snack I drizzled the quesadillas with my favorite Taco Sauce and they were gone! Loved this recipe!!!
I have made this and found if you remove the yellow squash and add diced green chili, it gives it a more authentic taste. I also added a salsa to dip.
What a great way to employ vegetables from my own garden. Easy to prepare; easy to make; and everyone enjoyed them. This recipe is a definite keeper.

Simple. Delicious. Healthy. I followed suggestions from a couple of the reviews, adding seasoning (I used McCormick’s Garlic ‘n Herb and a pinch of salt) and baking the quesadillas in a 425 degree oven for 8-9 minutes. I will definitely make this again!
Great recipe! I wanted to add a little Mediterranean flavor to it, so I topped them with plain tzatziki sauce (plain kefir, garlic, cucumber, salt and oil). Perfect taste! Will make them again.
This was the perfect lunch dish for a Sunday afternoon. We had an abundance of fresh zucchini & yellow squash from our garden and I used homemade salsa over the whole wheat tortillas. Delicious!
loved the food. my stove wont keep a constant temp though, so tortillas were either too done or not done enough. I used an iron pan. Any suggestions, besides geta new stove.
add various veggies
i make this for my family at every week. even my 3 year old eats these
Followed all directions except added jalapenos and garlic. Cooked in the oven. Used vegan cheese. We loved it and will make it again!

I did a few modifications. I used only one green zuchini and I added black olives. You can really alter the taste using different cheeses... great versatile recipe ! You could also add some black beans if you don't like olives.
Great idea! It needed a lil more flavor though, so I added fresh garlic and cilantro to the veggies after I cooked them for some extra flavor. It's a hit.

These were sooo good! I used the veggies I had (as suggested). So, mine consisted of red and green bell peppers, spinach, mushrooms, shallots, and corn. I also used colby because that's a preference and whole wheat carb balance burritos. I toasted one side in the pan them flipped them and filled the toasted side with the veggies and cheese while the other side toasted. I don't like soggy tortillas and thought this would help prevent that. It worked perfectly! These were really filling and incredible without seasoning! I will definitely be making these again!

Made this today (8/21/18)--had gotten a couple zucchinis from someone so thought this would be a healthier way of using them instead of zucchini bread or bars. I used red, yellow, and orange mini peppers; zucchini in place of the yellow squash since I didn't have any; and added 3-4 handfuls of fresh spinach. When I removed the quesadilla from the plan, I topped it with sour cream and picante. This was easy to make. Tastes like other veggie quesadillas I've had. Also, I would probably use a little more cheese than what is called for in the recipe. I agree with others that the filling seemed a little sparse. When I spread the amount called for on one tortilla, it was at least an inch from the edge of the tortilla. Smaller tortillas (or doubling the filling) would probably be a good idea. I'm not one for hot/spicy food but agree with other reviewers who noted the taste was rather bland. Maybe a little chili powder or some other spice added when cooking the veggies.
This is SO good! I love the fresh veggies that go into this, and I plan on making it again and experimenting with others, as was suggested in the reviews. Thank you for an incredible recipe!

Super fast & easy - and this is coming from someone who hates to cook! - so we'll definitely make these again. Left out the mushrooms because I forgot to buy more! Didn't put any cooking spray or oil on the pan - just let the veggies do their thing. Added some taco seasoning for a little boost. This makes enough for two meals, but keep the veggies separate - don't end up the next day with a soggy tortilla like I did. Still tasted good though!
Definitely will make again. Quick, easy, adaptable.
These are easy and quick and very tasty.
My vegetarian girl friend days these are just yummy. I enjoyed them also. Gonna try it with basil and garlic powder like the last guy said.
Very delicious! I substituted the whole wheat tortillas for corn tortillas since I am following a low sodium diet.
Super easy and delicious weeknight meal. Definitely will be on the regular dinner rotation.
My girlfriend made these for me and I fell in love!
So I started making this about a year ago. My kids still ask for it. I didn't change anything, I may swap up the veggies for preferred taste and I serve them on veggie tortilla shells. We love this!!
Wow this was amazing!!! Definitely making this again soon!
They were a little sloppy, but that's part of the fun. You can use any veg or cheese. Its all good.
They were a little sloppy, but that's part of the fun. You can use any veg or cheese. Its all good.
This was excellent! Needed to add some salt to the vegetables for flavor but the overall taste & health factor -- YUM!

Recipe was tasty and easy. My favorite kind.. I also added mushrooms and next time possibly some small diced chicken.
It's a keeper!
I sauteed garlic with sesame oil, then added green, yellow, red peppers, mushrooms, onions, pepper and salt and wow it was amazing! I also used coconut Pam spray for the tortillas..
These are a delicious way to get your kids to eat veggies. Great recipe.

I added cumin, salt, salsa, and garlic powder to add more flavor. I also added black beans for protein. It's such a great (and yummy) way to eat vegetables without feeling like your just eating vegetables. Went over really well with the family.
Made it exactly as the recipe called for - DELICIOUS!!!! Such a great way to use up some veggies you may have in your fridge!!!! Yum!
Simply delicious! I used yellow onion as did not have red; otherwise followed recipe exactly. Mexican food without guilt--love it!
These quesadillas are really good. I like to make them when my veggie barbarian son comes home on the weekend.
Seasoning is neither mentioned in the ingredients or the instructions, making me wonder why a recipe is at all necessary in the first place.

Love this recipe! 
Very easy and quick. I didn't change anything but you could add other vegetables. I will make put this in my regular recipes and make it often.
Update* I made this for friends on a girls getaway and they loved it too. I didn't change anything this time either.
We made this entree tonight. Delicious! First time ever attempting to make quesadillas. Decided to bake them in the oven after assembling. This was a hit with my family.
followed as written. The whole family enjoyed it and want this added to our regular recipe rotation.

I didn't use squash but I used all the other ingredients listed and they turned out great! I'll definitely be making these again. I did find that the amount of each ingredient wasn't enough so I'll just make more next time :)
Very tasty!

This is definitely something I will make again. My husband and I have decided to become vegetarians. And this recipe just hit the spot!The only thing I did different was changed the cheese to mexican blend and did not add mushrooms. This is a great entree, really.
I liked it. I put some leftover meat into the quesadilla and traded the zucchini and squash for other veggies, and it tasted wonderful ;)
The only thing missing from this was some type of bean. I also would have liked to try a different kind of cheese.
Great vegetarian entree! Family loved it. Added cumin for more flavor.
I followed the recipe exactly and it was excellent. I would add some herb seasoning the next time.
These were awesome! You can switch up the veggies!!!

I made this recipe after going to the farmers market today. I didn't have any mushroom or red pepper. I added green peppers, yellow peppers and added fresh tomatoes as well. I served it with salsa. My family loved it. Just watch how long you fry it as 1 1/2 minutes per side was plenty of time.

Add canned black beans (rinsed and drained), diced jalapeno, a little frozen corn, and some garlic powder or minced garlic for even more protein and extra flavor and kick. This dish is surprisingly filling! I doubled the recipe, and my bf and I were stuffed before we finished (and we are big eaters who were pretty hungry). I will definitely make this again!

The combination of veggies was real good :) I added cilantro to my veggies because that is the best herb in the world. I agree with some other reviewers, that the veggies needed some spice. I wish I would've sautéed the veggies with garlic. Maybe add cumin? Definitely top with guac!!!

I added just a hint of more cheese with a little less veggie mix but added some green onions, spinach, and black beans! I think this recipe is super good and just add or take to your taste! Will definitely make more of this with variations of what I have available.

This was really good. I made it as written, minus the peppers. This is one of those recipes that is very versatile. I will make it again. Maybe throw in some black beans next time. I wish it were a little easier to flip to the other side without sliding. Perhaps practice makes perfect. I will keep trying!
We really enjoyed this and believe it or not...I actually followed the recipe. I am famous for adding my own "touches" or using what I have.
Makes a bunch!

My 10mo baby, toddler, little girl, and husband ALL loved this! Big win in my book! I followed the recipe until they were assembled, and baked them on a greased baking sheet for 5 min at 425. Used avocado and sour cream to top it off. Thanks for the great recipe to add to our collection!
Very good quesadilla, had all the ingredients on hand and was looking for a quick meal. Thanks for submitting this recipe.
Very good! I used pepper jack cheese and baked it in the oven.

My daughter is a vegetarian and I am always looking for new recipes. I did as others did and baked them in the oven. The only changes I made - l added some garlic and a few mushrooms to the mix. I didn't use red pepper but cut up some tiny tomatoes . I only had very large tortillas. I halved the recipe and folded them over. They were delicious. My daughter gave them 5 stars too. I will add this recipe to the rotation. Thank you for it.
Never had made quesadillas before, but this turned out really good. Omitted the red pepper & yellow squash and added a little Perfect Pinch garlic & herb seasoning. Will definitely make again.
What a quick and simple and oh, so tasty supper dish! I made no changes. Didn't even need sour cream, salsa, etc. Always looking for something quick in my busy life!
Two changes. I mixed a blend of cheese. Shredded sharp and four cheese Mexican. Also put a dab (Tbs.) of plain Greek yogurt on top of each wedge.
Great, easy recipe! I love adding fresh vegetables to recipes! This was a very easy, but fun meal (especially if you prep the veggies beforehand).
Easy to make and very tasty.

Really does deserve more thasn 5 stars! It was delicious even without adding salt. I had some frozen Key West Chicken (from this site) that I chopped and added to the cooked veges. I will try adding a little balsamic vinegar next time. I couldn't eat this slowly!
Added ear of roasted sweet corn. Excellent!

These were Amazing! I loved the blend of vegetable flavors! I did make a couple of SMALL changes. I only had an orange pepper on hand so I subbed that for the red and also added a little mozzarella in with the cheddar but followed everything else to a "T". Will definitely be making these again!

It's a good base recipe we added Faux chicken strips grilled with mid chiles.
served with Salsa, sour cream and guacamole 

Um Yummy

When using reduced fat and whole wheat ingredients, I think you need to beef up the herbs and spices. The addition of chili powder, garlic, cumin, and oregano to the stir-fried veggies really ramps up the flavor. Extra virgin olive oil also makes the flavor more rich. Also when I make quesadillas, I fill half and fold over the top. Makes it SO much easier to flip! No pieces of cheese and veggies all over the pan!

I chopped, then placed the veggies in 1 Tbsp of grapeseed oil in a plastic zip bag adding seasoning salt & pepper. After thoroughly coating the veggies with oil and seasonings in the bag, I poured the oiled veggies into a grilling basket and roasted then on the patio grill. Remove the veggies when cooked and assemble the quesadillas. Spread a little oil on the both sides of the outside of the tortilla of the assembled quesadillas and finish grilling on the hot grill. Now, that's a great summer meal.
Easy to make and delicious!

We thought this was great! It made enough for us to fill 6 small tortillas which we folded over and baked for 7 minutes. We used 1 cup of extra old cheddar, butternut squash, and added some garlic with the veggies but no other changes.
These are very good. I only added a few things..I added some garlic powder and some chili powder.
My picky kids didn't realize it was made of only veggies. the only thing I did different was add a store brought packet of fajitas seasoning.
These were very good! I used squash, zucchini, onion, green pepper and some frozen corn and added some garlic and cumin. I also added some shredded Pepper Jack cheese. They were yummy! Thanks!!
This is my go to appetizer, although, I spread a layer of refried beans on the bottom tortilla, then add the sauteed veggies and top with the shredded cheese. They're a hit whever I go
Throw a couple of splashes of Balsamic vinegar in with the vegetables when you're cooking them. It's a game changer.

Recipe #1 of our new vegetarian/vegan lifestyle! I added fresh basil, sea salt, black pepper, green bell pepper, fresh minced garlic, and onion powder. I have a quesadilla maker which made for easy cooking. Used my food chopper but next time I would slice the veggies instead so that the quesadillas are thicker.

This was my first try at quesadillas and they were a big hit! I doubled the recipe (for six kids and two adults) and added in a can of corn. I'm only giving this four stars because it desperately needs spices to pull it up to five stars. Add in sea salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and basil, and you'll have a ten star dish. Serve with sour cream and salsa.

So good! Also added some curry seasonings with salt and pepper when grilling the veggies. Used two different types of cheese that I had on hand with soft corn tortillas. Added fresh Thai basil and just a bit of parsley before closing up the quesadilla to grill. Excellent for all the leftover veggies in the fridge that I hate to waste.
